events package¶

Submodules¶

events.admin module¶

events.models module¶

class events.models.Application(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Application objects link Users to Event objects and provide additional information

accepted = None¶

If this field is set to true, the application is accepted and the User becomes a Participant of the Event

applicant¶

The User issuing this application

date = None¶

Auto: The date when the application is created.

food_preferences = None¶

Food preferences as selected by the user

letter = None¶

Optional: Motivational letter, if the event requires one.

member_in()[source]¶

returns a String containing all :class:`Member`s the applicant is part of

priority = None¶

Optional: Priority of the application as issued by the corresponding LC

target¶

The Event the User is applying for.

class events.models.Event(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Event objects encapsulate all information that is necessary to describe an event.

category = None¶

Category of the event, for choices see CATEGORY_CHOICES .

deadline = None¶

Deadline until no more applications will be accepted.

description = None¶

A detailed description of the event. Pictures and videos can be included here

end_date = None¶

Optional: End of the event.

location = None¶

Optional: Location of the event.

max_participants = None¶

Optional: Maximum amount of participants that will be admitted to the event

name = None¶

Name of the event. Examples: bEErSTEC, Trainers’ Meeting, RISEX.

organizer_report = None¶

Optional: This is a field where the organizers report can be stored and accessed.

organizers¶

A list of all Users currently connected to the event as Organizers. Usually the head Organizers of the event.

organizing_committee¶

Defines the Organizing Members of the event. May be more than one. Only those Members can be selected, the editor is a priviledged member of.

participants¶

A list of all Users currently connected to the event as participants. They are added by accepting applications

participation_fee = None¶

Optional: Participation Fee for the event.

pax_report = None¶

Optional: This is a field where the participants report can be stored and accessed.

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

We try to add all Application`s' respective users to :attr:`participants .

scope = None¶

Scope of the event, an event can be local or international. The main event list will only contain International Events by default. Also see SCOPE_CHOICES.

start_date = None¶

Start of the event.

summary = None¶

A summary of the event. This will be displayed on the events page.
